channel.title: Too late to see the Perseids?
channel.description: I live in the DC Maryland Virginia area and I just found out today there was going to be a meteor shower. Is it too late to see the meteor shower? Is it practical to wait for it considering the moons blocking the way? Please respond.

item.title: Too late to see the Perseids?
item.dc:creator: calhoun_freeman
item.description:
Saw a meteor shower, and it’s not like the medias advertise it.

OH GOT IT WENT TEHR (all the crowd turn to blank sky and wait)

OH GOD IT WENT THER THIS TIME (repeat)

OH GOD ITS COMING LIKE EVERY 5 MINUTE THIS AINT WORTH IT (half the crowd leave)

Read full topic
item.source: Too late to see the Perseids?

item.title: Too late to see the Perseids?
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
its never a clear night in michigan, ever. and space is like the one thing i give a shit about???
fuck me, you know

Read full topic
item.source: Too late to see the Perseids?

item.title: Too late to see the Perseids?
item.dc:creator: _rot_fodder
item.description:
Pretty much way before and way after a meteor shower, there are still plenty of shooting stars. I saw a bunch of them the other night aswell, so if it’s a clear night, get out there and start watching. It might not be as spectacular, but it should still be good.

Read full topic
item.source: Too late to see the Perseids?
